section.name: 3. DataPort
section.p: This example demonstrates how Cayenne can be used to port relational data from one database to another. It shows the operation of the few internal parts of Cayenne, normally not used in the applications. DataPort also contains a working Ant task, so it has practical value for certain database maintenance tasks. The following things come to mind:

ul.li: Setting up database environment for individual developers, copying data from production or staging database.
Recreating predictable datasets in the test database for the purpose of unit testing (e.g. there can be a reference schema created manually, and a test schema that is refreshed on every test run).
Porting data between databases from different vendors (i.e. a case when there is no vendor supported data migration tools).
